metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20368 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-224546354References: Upstream kernel It was discovered that the Packet network protocol implementation in the Linux kernel contained an out-of-bounds access. A remote attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

notes.Note: sbeattie> Originally, there was confusion that the same commit appeared to fix CVE-2022-20158 as well as this CVE, but the information in the other CVE has been corrected. according to SUSE, the commit b2cf86e1563e ("packet: in recvmsg msg_name return at least sizeof sockaddr_ll") may also be needed for older kernels

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
